title: Introducing AgentKit, new Evals, and RFT for agents
optimized_headline: Discover AgentKit: New Evaluation Tools and RFT Transforming Agent Performance
raw_excerpt: Today, we’re releasing  new tools to help developers go from prototype to production faster: AgentKit, expanded evals capabilities, and reinforcement fine-tuning for agents.
raw_body: Today, we’re releasing  new tools to help developers go from prototype to production faster: AgentKit, expanded evals capabilities, and reinforcement fine-tuning for agents.
speedrun: A new set of tools has been launched to assist developers in transitioning from prototypes to production more quickly. Key features include AgentKit, enhanced evaluation capabilities, and reinforcement fine-tuning for agents. These tools aim to streamline the development process and improve the efficiency of AI agents. This is significant as it could accelerate innovation and deployment in various AI applications.
why_it_matters: Developers can now create and refine AI agents more efficiently, potentially reducing time to market. This could lead to quicker solutions for businesses.
On a broader scale, these advancements reflect a growing trend toward more accessible AI development tools, which could democratize technology and foster competition.

lenses.eli12: Imagine building a toy robot. AgentKit and the new tools help you make that robot faster and better. They allow developers to test and improve their AI agents quickly, making it easier to bring new ideas to life. This matters because it could lead to more innovative apps and services that everyone can use.
lenses.pm: For product managers and founders, these tools mean faster product development cycles. By using AgentKit and improved evaluation methods, teams can iterate on their AI features more efficiently. This could lead to reduced costs and quicker releases, meeting user needs more effectively.
lenses.engineer: From a technical perspective, AgentKit streamlines the development pipeline for AI agents, incorporating advanced evaluation techniques and reinforcement fine-tuning. These enhancements enable more robust testing and optimization of models, potentially leading to better performance metrics. However, developers should remain mindful of the integration challenges that may arise.
